text: After the issuance of a judgment, decree, or order granting custody, child support, or alimony, the Court retains jurisdiction for the entry of future orders modifying or terminating the initial judgment, decree, or order to the extent the retention of jurisdiction does not contravene other statutory provisions.
historical:

title.text: Particular Actions, Proceedings and Matters. (Refs & Annos)

chapter.text: Divorce, Annulment, Separation, Support, Etc. (Refs & Annos)

heading.catch_text: Retention of jurisdiction as to alimony, custody of children, and child support.
